channel.title: Basic HTB and Linux things on Arjen Wiersma
channel.description: Recent content in Basic HTB and Linux things on Arjen Wiersma

item.title: Basic Linux Commands
item.description: Copy contents of a file to the clipboard The xclip command is very useful when you want to copy files to the clipboard. sudo apt install xclip Use it as follows to put something on the internal clipboard of your VM: cat file | xclip -selection clipboard If you want to use it to copy something from you VM to your host machine, use the primary. cat file | xclip -selection primary
